name: Define Objective
description: Clearly articulate the desired end state or goal. This involves understanding the core intent, scope, and defining success criteria for the overall endeavor.
purpose: Establish a clear target for the process.
applicability_notes: This step is foundational and applies to any project, personal development goal, or problem-solving initiative. It sets the direction and provides a benchmark for success.
examples_of_usage: Defining the target user experience for a new software feature.
Articulating the desired outcome of a therapeutic session.
Specifying the learning objectives for a course.

name: Assess Current State
description: Evaluate the present situation, identifying strengths, weaknesses, available resources, and existing constraints that are relevant to the defined objective.
purpose: Understand the starting point and context.
applicability_notes: Essential for any process that aims to move from one state to another. It provides the necessary context for planning and identifying necessary changes.
examples_of_usage: Conducting a SWOT analysis for a business strategy.
Assessing a patient's current health status before treatment.
Reviewing existing code quality before refactoring.

name: Identify Gaps
description: Determine the discrepancies and differences between the current state and the defined objective. This highlights what needs to be addressed or changed.
applicability_notes: A critical step in understanding what needs to be done to achieve a goal. It bridges the 'as-is' and 'to-be' states.
examples_of_usage: Identifying skill gaps between current workforce and future needs.
Comparing a project's current progress against its timeline.
Finding the difference between desired functionality and implemented features.

name: Formulate Strategy
description: Develop a high-level plan or approach to bridge the identified gaps and achieve the defined objective. This outlines the general path forward.
applicability_notes: This step is about conceptualizing the 'how' at a broader level, before diving into specific tactics.
examples_of_usage: Devising a marketing strategy to increase brand awareness.
Developing a learning strategy to master a new skill.
Outlining a research strategy for a scientific inquiry.

name: Break Down Strategy
description: Decompose the overall strategy into smaller, more manageable phases, milestones, or sub-goals. This makes the strategy more actionable.
purpose: Deconstruct the plan into smaller parts.
applicability_notes: Essential for managing complexity. Breaking down large tasks into smaller units makes them less daunting and easier to track.
examples_of_usage: Breaking down a software development project into sprints.
Dividing a long-term personal goal into quarterly objectives.
Segmenting a complex research project into distinct stages.

name: Prioritize Actions
description: Sequence and rank the decomposed actions or sub-goals based on dependencies, impact, urgency, or strategic importance. This determines the order of execution.
applicability_notes: Ensures that efforts are focused on the most critical tasks first, optimizing resource utilization and progress.
examples_of_usage: Creating a priority list for bug fixes in software development.
Sequencing tasks in a project plan based on critical path.
Deciding which learning modules to tackle first based on foundational importance.

name: Allocate Resources
description: Identify, gather, and assign necessary resources, such as time, energy, personnel, tools, or budget, to the planned and prioritized actions.
applicability_notes: Ensures that the necessary means are available to execute the planned steps effectively.
examples_of_usage: Assigning developers to specific coding tasks.
Allocating budget for marketing campaigns.
Scheduling time for study sessions.

name: Execute Actions
description: Perform the prioritized tasks and implement the planned strategy. This is the active phase of carrying out the work.
applicability_notes: The core phase where work is done to move towards the objective.
examples_of_usage: Writing code for a software feature.
Conducting experiments in a lab.
Delivering a presentation.

name: Monitor Progress
description: Track the execution of actions, measure progress against planned milestones and objectives, and identify any deviations or issues in real-time.
applicability_notes: Ensures that the project stays on track and allows for timely intervention if deviations occur.
examples_of_usage: Tracking project status using Kanban boards.
Monitoring system performance metrics.
Regularly reviewing team progress in stand-up meetings.

name: Gather Feedback
description: Collect information and input on the outcomes of executed actions, both from internal stakeholders (e.g., team members) and external sources (e.g., users, customers, data).
applicability_notes: Essential for understanding the impact of actions and identifying areas for improvement.
examples_of_usage: Conducting user surveys after a product launch.
Soliciting code reviews from peers.
Gathering client feedback on delivered work.

name: Analyze Results
description: Evaluate the gathered feedback and progress data to understand the effectiveness of executed actions, identify successes, failures, and areas for improvement.
applicability_notes: Transforms raw data and feedback into actionable insights.
examples_of_usage: Analyzing sales data to understand campaign effectiveness.
Reviewing test results to identify root causes of failures.
Interpreting user feedback to prioritize feature requests.

name: Refine Approach
description: Adjust the strategy, priorities, or specific actions based on the analysis of results and feedback. This is an iterative process of optimization.
purpose: Optimize the plan based on learnings.
applicability_notes: Enables continuous improvement and adaptation to changing circumstances or new information.
examples_of_usage: Modifying a project plan based on scope changes.
Tuning algorithm parameters for better performance.
Updating a marketing campaign based on initial results.

name: Integrate Learnings
description: Incorporate insights gained from the analysis and refinement phases into the ongoing process, future plans, and the overall understanding of the objective.
applicability_notes: Ensures that experience leads to cumulative growth and prevents repeating past mistakes.
examples_of_usage: Updating best practice documentation based on project outcomes.
Incorporating user feedback into future product roadmaps.
Sharing lessons learned across teams.

name: Achieve State
description: Reach the defined objective or the desired state. This signifies the successful completion of the primary goal or a significant phase of it.
applicability_notes: Represents the culmination of effort and the successful realization of the initial objective.
examples_of_usage: Launching a completed software product.
Graduating from a program.
Successfully resolving a complex problem.

name: Sustain State
description: Implement practices and maintain conditions necessary to preserve the achieved state, preventing regression and ensuring long-term stability or continued progress.
applicability_notes: Crucial for ensuring that achievements are lasting and not temporary.
examples_of_usage: Ongoing system monitoring and maintenance after deployment.
Regular practice of learned skills to maintain proficiency.
Continuous quality assurance processes.
